column1: Norovirus is a virus (germ) that causes an infection of the stomach and intestines.
It can be spread when people: - Touch objects or surfaces that have been contaminated, then put their hands in their mouths.
Hospital staff and visitors should always stay home if they feel sick or have a fever, diarrhea, or nausea.
Even when there is not a norovirus outbreak, staff and visitors must clean their hands often: - Washing hands with soap and water prevents the spread of any infection.
